Text.Value: She has blessed the lantern's light. It is the Absolute who protects us from the shadows.

EditorData.NodeContext: Stress on first word. "*She* has blessed this light."

Text.Value: They think us fools, Majesty. They think we cannot see through their lies.
So how does this work, exactly?
Good. You may go now.
A mere mortal warrior could have never persevered alone... Ah! Of course!
I am a guardian of nature - and in return nature protects me.
To make the darkness quiver with mere song - you must have blessed them, my Queen. But if so... where is their lantern?
I have tested my mind and body beyond to its absolute limits - I do not fear the darkness.
This is not her Majesty's will.
One of your True Souls, my Queen! How have they survived?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Scuttles forward, holding the lantern to illuminate the player's face

Text.Value: They don't know? Our Queen told them nothing?
Indeed, it's time for you to go.
No, we will keep your gift and drive this false one back into the dark!
We will punish them for this blasphemy. We will make them scream!
Navigating dangerous terrain is second nature to me.
The Absolute wants you to go. Now!
Majesty? Is - is this true? Did I not serve you well?
If - if it is her majesty's will...
Attack the drider.
Very well. If it is your will, they can have it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Drider throws the Moonlantern to the ground in anger
EditorData.NodeContext: Drider throws the Moonlantern to the ground in anger

Text.Value: With the aid of my mind and my magic, for I am a master of both.
I swore an oath - a powerful one. It will take more than darkness to end me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
The HALF-ORC shoots you a dirty look, but follows the DRIDER into the darkness, along with the other cultists. There is silence for a beat before screams start to pierce the air. There is sound of a brief battle. 

To account for Vez being dead or alive we will rely on a Show Actor key in Node N858.
EditorData.SFXTags: [KC] Screams and sounds of battle as the caravan fight shadow creatures off-screen

EditorData.stateContext:
Drider and party are off-screen. Moonlantern on the ground.
 Harpers are out of sight/not present

Text.Value: But the druids have no power here, not since... Ah, of course!
No - that lantern is mine, by order of the Absolute. Give it - now.
Simply shadows. Cursed, hungry shadows, trying to grab the living. And they are getting stronger.
I am both a True Soul and a cleric. I've blessed you with the power of the Absolute - you'll be safe.
If we in the Underdark, I would split you open, drider. Leave before I change my mind.
Never mind me, how have you survived the curse?
Lantern? Is that what protects you out here?
That lantern is mine - by order of the Absolute. Drop it, or I'll shatter your spine as the wind breaks a twig.
Traitor - heretic!
You blessed them too, my Queen? Where is their lantern?
The Absolute has asked me to carry the lantern. Hand it over.
I burn with pure arcana - how on earth do you survive?
No, we will keep your gift and drive this false one back into the dark!
The Absolute guided me here. She said a mere drider was not worthy - that I must take your lantern.
But majesty, you gave this lantern to me. You said it was mine!
They will follow close. Do not leave the light!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Drider turns and starts to leave, ready to head into the dark. You're expected to follow.

Text.Value: Question me again, and I will make drag you into the darkness - screaming.
But majesty, you gave this lantern to me. You said it was mine!
You know what they say - a ballad a day, keeps the darkness away!
There is but one god - and she is Absolute.
The shadows do not hunt me as they do others. What are they, exactly?
Protects us from what? What are the shadows, exactly?
Majesty! Please...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Off screen, cries from the darkness, which fade to an eerie silence.
EditorData.NodeContext: Off screen, being killed by shadow monsters. He cries out, begging his god to save him, but it's too late

Text.Value: Ah, you swore an oath to my Queen! But if so... where is their lantern?

EditorData.stateContext:
Drider is holding moonlantern. Drider Mindmelding.
 Harpers are out of sight or not present.
 Vez is dead or alive.

Text.Value: IF IT IS HER MAJESTY'S WILL, THEN WE SHALL WALK!
Or I could kill you and take that light.

EditorData.stateContext:
Drider is holding moonlantern. 
 Harpers are out of sight or not present.
 Vez is dead or alive

Text.Value: *As the sounds fade, there is nothing left but cold, still silence.*

EditorData.stateContext:
Drider is holding moonlantern.
 Harpers have stepped back into shadows, leaving the players facing the ambush location alone

Text.Value: No higher forces protect me - I survived by my own tenacity.
Step into the light! Let us see you.
Someone in the dark, mistress.
Thank you - let's go.
You're holding my lantern. The Absolute said you had to give it to me.
GO. NOW.
(Wave hands.) There - you now carry the blessing of the Absolute. You'll be safe.
The Absolute protected me.
ROAR.
ROAR.
Takes more than shadows to put someone like me down.
Our goddess protects us. We carry her sacred light to drive back the shadows.
Magic alone could never have persevered... Ah! Of course!
You can't be serious. You know what's out there-
Lady Shar protects me - I do not belong to your Queen.
My god does not fear the shadows - I do not belong to your Queen.
My god's favour protected me - I do not belong to your Queen.
I am not one of hers - divine light guides my footfall.
Yes, majesty, your light can shield another of your faithful. They will join us on the road.
The Absolute guided me to you. She said I was to take yours.
*Your minds connect and you hear a voice whispering to you. The Absolute? Or just the echoes of his fractured mind, reverberating in the darkness?*
The Absolute has blessed you. You will be safe.
Securus! There - you now carry the blessing of the Absolute. You'll be safe.
Our wondrous Queen dropped me a message - she said you need to give me that lantern. It's very important.
But do not worry, there is still power in the lantern. Our queen will protect you, as she protected me.
That lantern is mine - by order of the Absolute. Drop it, or I'll boil your brain inside your skull.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] SCENE_SCL_HarpersandPlayersAmbush_Hidden_Reveal_PLYR <OllieS> Player goes from a sneak pose, walks forward into a standing idle
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player moves into the light. Player's positioning should match N218 so it merges into the rest of the dialog flow

Text.Value: To have a rage so fierce the dark quivers - you must have blessed them, my Queen! But if so... where is their lantern?
Vale, idiotae! There - you now carry the blessing of the Absolute. You'll be safe.
Nere? A fickle, unworthy servant to our Queen.
She will protect us. She - she must.
Attack the drider.
I would use the drow Nere's lantern, but it broke.
I would use True Soul Nere's lantern, but it broke.

EditorData.stateContext:
Drider no longer holding the Moonlantern.
 Harpers are out of sight/not present
 Moonlantern on the ground.
 Vez is dead or alive

Synopsis: The players have agreed to help the Harpers ambush a caravan of Absolute cultists and prisoners. You've just arrived at the ambush site - the mood is tense, words are spoken in harsh whispers. When the Caravan arrives there's a monsterous drider at its head, muttering to itself, talking to an imaginary queen/majesty that represents the voice of his God, The Absolute. The player can try to trick the drider into handing over its magic lantern (the Moonlantern - a glowing lantern hanging from the end of a staff), although that could leave the drider exposed to the worst effects of the curse. Will likely end in combat, either because you signaled the Harpers to spring their ambush or because the drider got suspicious and attacked.
